sections.summary:
The Digital skills certificate is a great way of improving your digital skills across a range of areas. For students, it goes on your HEAR (Higher Education Achievement Report) when you graduate, shows off your skills to prospective employers and is part of the Lancaster award and iDEA award. To gain the Digital skills certificate, you must pass at least one course from each of the categories below.

  • About the Digital skills certificate
  • View passed courses and export badges
  • Redeem Lancaster award, iDEA award or Lancaster professional programme credit
  • Latest updates and announcements
sections.name: Digital Skills Certificate

skillsSpace.name: Communication, Collaboration and Participation
skillsSpace.summary:
Using digital technologies and social networks to improve engagement with others, socially and professionally.

The following courses are available in this category:

  • Managing files with Microsoft OneDrive
  • Online surveys with Qualtrics
  • Email and calendars with Microsoft Outlook
  • Blogging with WordPress
  • Communication and collaboration with Microsoft Teams

skillsSpace.name: Creation and Innovation
skillsSpace.summary:
Designing and producing new content, information and data through innovative application of technology.

The following courses are available in this category: 

  • Creating accessible resources
  • Introduction to computational mathematics in Matlab
  • Image editing with paint.net
  • Presenting information with visual impact
  • Video production with Adobe Premiere Rush and Adobe Premiere Pro 
  • Writing documents with LaTeX
  • Statistical programming with RStudio
  • Introduction to programming in Python
  • Web editing with Terminalfour CMS (For staff by request)

skillsSpace.name: Identity and Wellbeing
skillsSpace.summary:
Understanding the potential impact of digital technologies on health, wellbeing and individual identity.

The following courses are available in this category:
  • Online networking with LinkedIn
  • Digital wellbeing
  • Intercultural competencies
  • Professional use of social media

skillsSpace.name: Information, Data and Media
skillsSpace.summary:
Managing, evaluating, assimilating and using information and data in a range of media.

The following courses are available in this category:

  • Analysing and presenting data with Microsoft Excel
  • Finding academic resources with OneSearch 
  • Information security
  • Statistical data analysis with SPSS
  • PDF editing with Adobe Acrobat

skillsSpace.name: Learning and Self Development
skillsSpace.summary:
Having the capacity to identify and participate in digital learning opportunities.

The following courses are available in this category:

  • Formatting documents with Word
  • Mind mapping with MindJet
  • Introduction to referencing and reference management tools
  • Digital project management
  • Introduction to Moodle (For staff)
  • Course administration in Moodle (For staff)
  • Online assessment and feedback for assignments in Moodle (for staff)
  • Creating interactive learning materials with Xerte
